The staff dresses any type of way. There is no way to tell a waiter/waitress from a patron unless they are carrying a pizza or food. I guess her job was to cut the pizza's. This was the only task I saw her do. I also watched the same young woman play in her hair

I witnessed friends of the host get seated before us. Put in our order for caryout and the host came to us at 1:20 mins after arrival. I declined. Pizza was in my hand at 1:30 after arrival. Walked home and enjoyed good pizza. Never again on a Friday will I be seen at Comet Ping Pong! Also

Review_Contents: Upon entering the restaurant you find a rustic setting with a mix of clientele. Families and youthful to middle age couples who are either casual to business casual. The restroom is hidden. It's behind a wooden panel with no sign. Just push on the wall. A father and his children mentioned that they thought it was cool. There are ping pong tables in the back and the tables where you are seated are also fashioned after ping pong tables with seating similar to a picnic bench. First we started with the Comet Wings. They are a milder version of jerk wings with a bit of sweetness. The meat is flavorful and falls off the bone. We accompanied our meal with a recent rotating tap offering. A good and malty Oatmeal Stout. Their pizza sauce is homemade jarred sauce using carefully selected tomatoes with a balanced blend of spices. The crust holds up well and has just enough air in it so that it's crisp but light. However
User_Name: I would like a little less char on the outer crust. I had the Stanley which had roasted red pepper and fresh fennel sausage. My pizza could have had a bit more cheese but
Review_Cool: the flavors of each topping were clean and distinct. MY BF had the Smoky with mushrooms

This is one of me and my boyfriend's favorite pizza joints - we drive all the way from Baltimore to get it! Normally we sit inside
User_Name: which has a very funky vibe w/ cool decorations
Review_Cool: but this time we sat out front on the patio. It's beautiful and surrounded by plants (though a bit buggy- they have Off! on request!). Make sure to make a reservation. Once you arrive you'll be seated and you order from your phone! Very cool.The pizza is unique and delicious
User_2021_Elite: with combos I haven't found anywhere else. We started off with fried Mac and cheese bites

Review_Contents: If you like amazing pizza with countless options GET YOUR BUTT OVER HERE! This pandemic has made app-based ordering a central part of our lives
User_Name: and no matter what platform I use
Review_Cool: Comet Ping Pong gets it right every time. Their garlic knots are AWESOME and very big. But more importantly
User_2021_Elite: I have loved every single pizza I've ever gotten here. My personal favorite is the pesto pizza with chicken

Review_Contents: Great Pizza.l
Review_Cool: but real wood-fired oven Italian Pizza. Better than Two Amys. The place has an interesting Decor. I'm told it is a family place on weekends and nights.Oh
User_2021_Elite: and they don't have a basement

Review_Contents: I thought the pizza here was decent and they also have good beer. It's a bit out of the way for me to come here frequently but I would recommend this pizza place.

The gyro pizza is better than most restaurant gyros that you get in the city. The lamb and sauce somehow both come thru and you can taste it individually in the same bite. The smoky white pie has just the right amount of smokey flavor
User_Name: and the bacon on it is incredible. The bacon and mushrooms play very well off each other and the whole of the ingredients tie together with the smokey flavor. Can't recommend those two pies high enough""
Review_Cool: Coral D.

Review_Contents: Staff was very friendly
User_Name: atmosphere was great on a nice night to sit outside with a fire very cozy. We ordered three pies between the two of us. The Sunrise
Review_Cool: The Dream and one of their Specialty Pies. The pizza was phenomenal did not disappoint whatsoever. Favorite pizza in DMV area by far!""

Review_Contents: pizza is amazing
User_Name: and the ping pong in the back area is so much fun. they have live bands performing sometimes
Review_Cool: which are super cool to see! i've been going here sense i was a little kid

Review_Contents: Ordered online at 7 pm
User_Name: said would be ready at 7:45. ニ_ニ_Pulled up and a swarm of people waiting in back for pick up. They were turning away doordash. ニ_ニ_Ended up get my pick up at 8:20 pm. Basically they are overwhelmed by doorsash.""
Review_Cool: Jonathan E.

Review_Contents: Beer
Review_Cool: and ping pong kick ass. Comet Ping Pong has each. It's just not a good idea combining them at the same time. Go to the bar first. Then get your game on. Comet Ping Ping has two main areas. First area is the bar. It's right past where you walk in. It has lots of room so you can bring a few buds. There's also plenty of booths and tables. On tap are lots of craft and local beers. They have a happy hour special when you can get $1 off certain drafts. As for the food
User_2021_Elite: the pizza is the best. The rest of the menu is mostly fried stuff. Pizza in whatever size here is expensive. The Veganista pizza is about $15 for a personal size. In the back are the ping pong tables and bathrooms. Most of the players are amateurs

Review_Contents: Mixed feelings. I ordered take out online through their website. They emailed me back and told me my order of 2 pizzas would be ready in one hour. I was glad
User_Name: this meant they were busy with a ton of orders. I called two times to check the status of the order; no answer both times. I was worried the order would be ready early sitting there getting cold so I decided to stop by 20 minutes early. Guess what! It was ready waiting. Thank goodness I came by. I had to put my pizza in the oven when I got home. I ordered the dream pizza. The pizza was average. This pizza is expensive; I didn't realize it was a 8-9inch pie. Im all for supporting local restaurants especially during this time but at the same time this was a special treat and money not well spent on small cold pizzas.""
Review_Cool: Stacey G.

Review_Contents: What's better than ping pong withh pizza? ニ_ニ_I've been here for years and even had a birthday party here. Maybe the birthday party wasn't the best idea since it's hard to get seating for a large crowd
User_Name: but now in the era of social distancing it should be easier. ニ_ニ_The pizza was fanatstic and it was great to be able to play pizza after. I wish I understood the ping ping queue though. It was quite the wait. But worth it. I hope to be back when the pandemic is over!""
Review_Cool: Yan W.

Review_Contents: Amazing pizza and atmosphere. 5 stars!!!! I used to like their live music now I just enjoy the great pizza.
Been a customer for 10 years and this place has really gone downhill
User_Name: last two times have been poor experiences. Last six months of google reviews confirm as well. Pick-up three weeks ago required long wait
Review_Cool: w/ no parking outside
User_2021_Elite: and got cold food in the end. Door dash order tonight resulted in phone call from restaurant that they didn't bother to update menu on app

Review_Contents: Amazing pizza-- my go-to spot in DC. The crust is perfectly thick
Review_Cool: perfectly cooked. The Stanley is my favorite- delicious homemade sausage. But so much creativity elsewhere in the menu as well!""

Review_Contents: Two hours for delivery isn't """"struggling during Covid"""" - it's just a business that shouldn't offer a delivery option if it can't scale. First and last time ordering from here""
Easily my favorite pizza place in DC
User_Name: for several reasons.Walking in it's hard to ignore the incredibly cool atmosphere they've built. Tables made to look like ping pong tables
Review_Cool: unfinished distressed walls
User_2021_Elite: fun art in just enough places. My favorite touch was two projectors on the wall. One showing a performance art piece

Review_Contents: How come haven't I tried Comet Ping Pong before? Phenomenal menu items
Review_Cool: beautiful atmosphere - what more could you ask for? The menu is really wonderful

Review_Contents: I almost don't care how fantastic the pizza is. TWO HOUR wait for dinner is not acceptable. At least be honest with the customer so that we at least have the option to go somewhere else or open a can of soup for dinner.
I've been to Comet a few times now
User_Name: having recently moved to the area. My go to is the smoky- it's absolutely delicious. It's a white pizza
Review_Cool: which isn't what I usually go for

Review_Contents: Comet Ping Pong is a waste of a wood fired oven. I came to see a band play (the venue is great) and ordered some pizzas before the show. I had very low expectations for their pizza and was still blown away by how awful it was.I like cheap pizza when it is marketed (and priced) as cheap pizza. When it costs $14-$17 it should be on par with the amazing pizza joints the DMV has to offer (Stellina
Review_Cool: Timber

Review_Contents: Comet Ping Pong is c-o-o-l. I grew up in D.C. and I went back around the time when it first opened. It was memorable then
User_Name: but it's really evolved into something more. It's become an establishment. Pizzas are wood-fired - reminiscent of neopolitan style - and served on ping-pong table style booths. Stacks of wood for the stove are stored near the back entrance
Review_Cool: giving the space a cozy
User_2021_Elite: rustic - if slightly industrial - feel. The atmosphere is casual

Review_Contents: I came to Comet Ping Pong at the recommendation of a friend. He said the pizza and wings were great
User_Name: so I had to see for myself. I came on a Saturday evening around 7. It was respectably busy
Review_Cool: but not obnoxiously. We were able to be seated immediately
User_2021_Elite: but we sat at the bar. The bar has a variety of drafts and a few liquors. Aesthetically

Review_Contents: The pizza took ニ_ニ_two hours
User_Name: were cold and the driver said he was made to wait for another order. Don't care
Review_Cool: it took two hours.""

Review_Contents: So yeah
User_Name: I'm that guy who wanted to go because of #Pizzagate. I wasn't expecting a lot
Review_Cool: just hoping for the decent pizza with a novelty atmosphere (and maybe some screams from the back). The pizza was below par. The crust (oh so important) was extremely bland and tasted more like bad cornbread. The sauce was very light and nothing to write home about. The draft selection was limited to 3 (4?) beers. Overall very unimpressed. But I also didn't get to snoop around to see if the rumors were true.""

Review_Contents: This place has an amazing vibe and really good food. It's a shame some weird conspiracy theorists have decided to target this business for no reason with weird rumors. It's really just a wonderful pizza place. You should support it.
The servers were very nice
User_Name: very good. The food was OK
Review_Cool: portions are small and somewhat pricey for a dive atmosphere. The three ping-pong tables were occupied nonstop (even though the rest of the restaurant was nearly-empty). I didn't see a queue or timer system

Review_Contents: Located north of Van Ness and a little east of Tenleytown
User_Name: Comet is located on a cut little street with restaurants
Review_Cool: a bookstore
User_2021_Elite: and some coffee shops. They have outdoor seating with cute string lights and ample bench seating (+ping pong!) inside.The restaurant features a classic American menu

Review_Contents: I love this place it looks so nice and they have live music which is great!I will definitely be coming back!!!
Inappropriate and disturbing art displayed in this place! Original owner James Alefantis is........Nevermind
User_Name: just look him up for yourself! Search deeper than what Google has to offer up front..""
Review_Cool: Jasmine B.

Review_Contents: Some of their menu items are AMAZING. They have some really creative pizzas that Ive never seen anywhere else. The Gyro pizza is killer. It can be a bit on the pricey side
User_Name: but how often can you find a fun pizza restaurant that also has awesome food and entertainment. Plus it has the added fun of know that thousands of crazy people think the owners are Satan worshipers turning dead kids into pizza. I guess lamb and children taste the same. Who knew? In all seriousness
Review_Cool: it was a fun place to stop when i was in DC. These guys deserve the business
User_2021_Elite: don't make judgements based on crazy people who know Little Caesars as the only pizza they eat (cuz they cant afford more)""

Review_Contents: God bless these people! Went to DC and made it a point to support this restaurant. Really good pizza made in a brick oven the way it is supposed to be! Really nice staff! And I played ping pong for the first time in decades and it was fun. The bad reviews are coming from the Qanon crowd who still want to keep their conspiracies going even after they caused a domestic terrorist attack on a family establishment full of children. Their lie against this establishment was debunked over and over again. Like ALL their lies are but sadly
User_Name: they don't care. They have no other life but to hurt others.""
Review_Cool: Cool Cats ..

Review_Contents: Didn't really want to leave a bad review knowing all of the issues restaurants have to deal with with COVID...but taking over 3 hours for an order just isn't acceptable. Take your business elsewhere.
I'm so bummed. I've heard such create things about this place and have been meaning to visit for years. My boyfriend and I visited this evening and were seated on the patio
User_Name: which was really nice. The restaurant seemed to take the pandemic quite seriously with clear signage
Review_Cool: sanitizer on every table and the phone scan menu. Unfortunately
User_2021_Elite: the waitress couldn't bother to put her mask over her nose and for some reason handed us paper menus. We were willing to overlook because hey

Review_Contents: Through and through not a good experience at Comet Ping Ping. We were the only customers in the restaurant the entire time
User_Name: at 4:30PM. We went and played ping pong and the tables were average at best
Review_Cool: must be old tables that they've had since they opened in 2006. The restaurant's interior is very rundown which makes for a poor dining experience. The pizza we ordered was very small
User_2021_Elite: and still highly priced. The pizza was bland

Review_Contents: I came here with some friends on a bustling Friday evening. The crowd definitely seems to come in waves. For 20 minutes
User_Name: it was looking like we'd have no luck getting a table
Review_Cool: but all of a sudden
User_2021_Elite: multiple seats in the main area opened up.Caveat is that we didn't play ping pong. But we had a few rounds of drinks

Review_Contents: Good pizza. ニ_ニ_I had a pizza with crab and another was the yalie. ニ_ニ_Creative and fun menu. ニ_ニ_It's a casual pizza place with a fun and relaxing atmosphere. ニ_ニ_I love pizza from everywhere and this place is outstanding. ニ_ニ_Give it a try. ニ_ニ_Good beer and prices too.
Admittedly
User_Name: my wife and I visited because we were interested in seeing the place surrounded by conspiracy theories. It's strange because the owner is named one of the top 50 most influential people in Washington DC
Review_Cool: and had all this weird imagery on his page
User_2021_Elite: and it was even on that Diners And Drive in's show claiming to be one of the best places to eat in DC. We tried the pizza and it was unfortunately like cardboard with little to no flavor. I wanted to look around

Review_Contents: I throughly enjoyed my visit here. It was my first time
User_Name: the pizza was pretty good. I can't wait to go back
Review_Cool: they have ping pong tables in the back which was different. It was a nice little hangout spot....I would go back for sure. They have a nice beer list if you're into that.""

Review_Contents: I'm a little torn on how to review Comet Ping Pong. I almost wish Yelo had a """"?"""" option for the rating scale. Hopefully by the time I finish writing this review I'll narrow down a firm number.We stopped by on a Wednesday night around 8. The resturant was still pretty busy- which was surprising. We found free street parking and there's an outdoor patio. After being seated we started with garlic knots. The order came with two large knots. Due to the size the only garlic taste was on the outside. I felt like I was eating plain bread. I don't think I would order this again. At around $15 a pizza this is an expensive dinner. The pizzas are individually sized and the only way to share is if you were to order a salad and an appetizer. I went with the Cheesus Crust- a multi cheese white pizza. The goat cheese was WAY to over powering. I couldn't taste anything else. My boyfriend went with the Spring Chick- pesto base with Chicken. He liked the pizza but didn't find it worth the money. We both took pizza home but I wasn't in a rush to eat it. I will say that the resturant has a build your own option (cost adds up super quick) which I would probably do the next time. I think it's more about finding the right thing to order here and once you do it'll be great. Unfortunately we didn't find those items. I don't think I would ever suggest coming back but if someone wanted to go I would tag along.""

It was OK. Pizza was decent but nothing spectacular. Place had plenty of empty tables when we arrived but for some reason they sat us in the very back table next to the ping pong area with all the screaming kids. When we arrived
User_Name: the hostess gave us a weird look as if we didn't belong there. I looked around at everyone who looked similar to us. Only thing missing was melanin. ::shrug:: It's not usually an issue in other places but I guess the hostess considered it important. I looked at all the empty tables as we were leaving the restaurant. Yep
Review_Cool: we still could have been sat somewhere more quieter. I wonder if they put us there to advertise their ping pong tables? ニ_ニ_A ten inch pizza costs about $15. It was bland with no flavor. I get much fresher ingredients and better flavor from the pizza within walking distance of my house. AND it costs much less than $15. ニ_ニ_I wonder if they put their name into the stupid conspiracy to get people to visit. This place is a far hike from the main attractions of DC so it's definitely more of a locals spot. That part was nice
User_2021_Elite: but really it isn't worth the hike at all.""

Review_Contents: This was my first trip to Comet Ping Pong. The pizza was good and staff was friendly
User_Name: but the condensation dripping off the pipes in the ceiling and onto our table and drinks was a bummer :-(""
Review_Cool: Brian L.

Review_Contents: Long lines to get into Comet Ping Pong have kept my family from visiting Comet until recently. Pandemic pickup had us go back to this neighborhood favorite. I'm so glad we did. While the individual pizzas are a tad pricey
User_Name: the ability of everybody to order their own pizza with tailored toppings is a delight. No family compromises. At least on pizza. For one night. Hurray!""
Review_Cool: LS C.

Review_Contents: Got carryout and wasn't sure what to expect from Comet
User_Name: I've heard mixed reviews in the past--mostly leaning toward positive though! We ordered The Smoky pizza for dinner and the mac 'n cheese bites to start. The pizza tastes true to its name: smoky and woodsy which we loved but this might be a plus or minus depending on preference. The pizza was really great flavor-wise but few slices didn't have many toppings. The mac 'n cheese bites were really cheesy and tasty but I could see them being pretty blah once they cool down. Best served hot! The person that I ordered from was funny and patient when I asked a couple questions about the menu. A nice environment
Review_Cool: outdoor patio option with string lights and open space indoors with ping pong tables in back as well as music venue. Definitely recommend for the experience if not the good grub.""

Review_Contents: We came here for a show in the back room. I got a mango sour beer which I thought was super yummy
User_Name: and the venue space was really nice and intimate. Looking forward to trying their pizza someday!""
Review_Cool: Elizabeth B.

Review_Contents: Hole in the wall pizza place with a game room in the back. ニ_ニ_Comet Ping Pong is located on Connecticut Avenue about a mile north of the Van Ness UDC Train Station
User_Name: close to a CVS and The Little Red Fox. ニ_ニ_The restaurant has a lot of small tables inside and a fewer number of small tables outside in an enclosed dining area. ニ_ニ_In the back of the restaurant
Review_Cool: there are three ping pong tables and a foosball table for entertainment before or after you're done eating. ニ_ニ_Service was good - water was refilled at a good rate throughout the meal.On the Menu: The appetizers include wood-roasted vegetables (squash

Review_Contents: We were visiting my sister in DC and she said we had to try Comet Pizza. We are vegan so we were skeptical that they would have food we would like. We were surprised when we arrived at how open and fun the interior was. It looks so industrial and stylish. Love the super high ceilings

Review_Contents: Wonderful pizza place to bring friends from out of town. Had some friends in town from Toronto and wanted to take them somewhere fun and unique to eat. I had seen this restaurant on Triple D and immediately thought of it. Was not disappointed.Went in around 6:15 on a Friday night. Had to wait 20-30 for a table but that was completely expected. They have us a buzzer and we could go to the little cage next door for a drink while we waited. Each of us ordered our own pizza. Between us we had The Jimmy
Review_Cool: The Cabbage Patch and The Pork. We all shared so I was able to try all four. I think they were all excellent but my favorite had to the The Jimmy. The meatballs on it were so delicious. But my second favorite what The Cabbage Patch with its Brussel Sprouts. My friends had some IPA that was on tap but I was driving home that night and didn't try any. They did like it though. Our waiter was funny and sweet. He took real good care of us. Got to play ping pong too for a bit but there were a bunch of people waiting so we didn't play too long. I believe they have 4 ping pong tables and it's free to play. That was fun. Haven't played in years and it was neat to do while waiting for food. I am very pleased I had this little gem stored to bring friends to. They really enjoyed it and I think it's a place they'll remember.""

Review_Contents: I went to Comet Ping Pong to celebrate a friend's birthday on 5/3/15. Although I liked the concept of this place I can't give it a high rating. I am going to start off with what I liked about this restaurant and then move to why it is not receiving a higher rating. I liked the fact the restaurant had the vibe of industrial architecture with splashes of modern art pieces. As the other Yelpers have mentioned
User_Name: the restaurant also has a parking lot in the back (which was reassuring when we decided to drive there from Alexandria
Review_Cool: VA). I really enjoyed the dessert I had with my friends (after a spirited round of ping pong in the back of the restaurant). The non-dessert food was just okay and was somewhat limited for a vegetarian such as myself (which frankly surprised me because pizza places usually are safe bet for vegetarians). My pizza had garlic. Instead
User_2021_Elite: of having the garlic minced or shredded on the pizza; I had 2 large cloves of garlic placed on my pizza. Our waiter was a little scattered brained. He arrived without a working pen to take our order. He also came back to the table after we placed our orders within 5 minutes to take our orders again. Although

Review_Contents: I would just like to say that while the ambiance is nice the service is horrible. A group of friends and I wanted to come to the restaurant and enjoy a quick dinner. When we asked to be seated they told us there would be a 40 minute wait to which we expressed was too long. When we asked to order out
User_Name: another large group entered the restaurant and was seated immediately
Review_Cool: no reservation. They were continuously rude to us and were annoyed when we asked why we could not be seated even though there were several tables available. The pizza was small and overpriced... a shame.""

Review_Contents: As a native Washingtonian who grew up in Northwest
User_Name: I always try to support local business; especially when they're targeted by nut jobs and have right-wing conspiracy theories made up about them that incite violence. On a more relaxed note
Review_Cool: Comet has amazing gluten free pizza. It's probably the best gluten-free pizza I've ever tasted in my life. So much gluten free bread products are thin and crispy and what I miss most about eating gluten is that soft doughy sensation that you get when you take a bite. The crust on the pizza is just like that! I highly recommend it. Their other options are not so gluten friendly in terms of appetizers and certainly not desserts. They do have some gluten free beers. It's always super crowded because it's very popular so I guess that's a minus that it's loud. I've never played the ping pong but I'm sure it would be very fun. Also I wish they would deliver!""

Review_Contents: Awesome and chill place to grab a late night bite to eat or drink. Ping pong tables in the back for beginners to more advanced players. The bartender is amazing and welcoming (Ante) and makes you feel like a member of the Comet family.

So the 2016 word of the year according to the Oxford dictionary is """"post-truth"""". And I wish this was a non-sequitur but we happened to be eating here a few days ago. When a gunman showed up. I'll re-write this review when I've come back a second time but I want it to be known that the staff handled the incident incredibly well. When it became apparent that there was a gunman on the premises waitstaff quickly
User_Name: and discreetly went around to tables ushering people out. It was not the dining experience we'd expected. I'm so sorry to the staff and owners at Comet Ping Pong that your business is suffering as a result of fake news. And thank you for remaining so calm and organized in the face of a scary situation. I'll be back
Review_Cool: but I'm still a little freaked out.""

Review_Contents: I used to be a regular at Comet Ping Pong when one of my besties lived down there. And I used to love the taco-pizza and the Yalie (clam pizza). But then my friend moved to the 'burbs and I hadn't been back.Until a few weeks ago. I was in the neighborhood running errands

It was burnt and the marinara was bitter and salty. Yuck! We complained to the owner who happened to be there that evening. What a smug prick. I don't understand why ppl bring their kids here either. The artwork in the back is totally inappropriate for minors. Parents beware.

Review_Contents: My son has a severe milk allergy and allergies to other foods. Comet
Review_Cool: is the best pizza! They use a delicious vegan cheese (not Daiya which my son does not like) and we usually get it with pepperoni and italian sausage. The most important thing-they know how to handle food allergies. We go there almost every week and he has never had any allergic reaction. My son has had reactions in other places even though they say they know how to manage food allergies and prevent cross contamination. Comet Ping Pong is the #1 favorite restaurant in our family because of the yummy pizza and keeping my son safe from an allergic reaction.""

Review_Contents: Heard about Comet after the awful news of what happened there. My wife and I decided to eat dinner here one night to try it out and to show our support. For an appetizer we ordered garlic knots and the wings. The wings were very good (and probably the best thing we had). They were juicy on the inside and crispy on the outside. The garlic knots were dry and nothing more than some bread with a garlic butter over them. For our main dish we ordered the philly calzone and the yalie. The calzone was bitter because of whatever the vegetables were sauted in. The pork loin was dry and I didn't really like anything from this dish. My wife thought the yalie was...interesting. A pizza she wouldn't order again. We decided to try some dessert and ordered the brownie a la mode. I don't know how you can possible have a bad brownie a la mode
User_Name: but I guess you can. The ice cream was fine but the brownie was hard and probably just fudge. Overall the atmosphere was fun and having ping pong tables at a restaurant is exciting but we didn't get to play with all of the kids playing. The service was slow at first - our apps didn't come out until the same time as our main dishes. We probably won't come back to over pay for meals that weren't that good.""
Review_Cool: Laura M.

Review_Contents: I've been back to comet time and time again since I moved to the area a few years back. I've always found the staff to be friendly and attentive. The wings are still the real stars of Comet's menu in my eyes. They are the only food item I can confidently claim that I have never had a better version of it outside of D.C. And the horseradish sauce is to die for.The restaurant itself is a little loud - especially on weeknights since it really is a neighborhood restaurant full of families and locals from all walks of life. It's an odd cross between being almost a punk club and a family-friendly restaurant.

My husband and I actually had our wedding rehearsal dinner here in the back room in April 2013. It turned out great and the atmosphere was surprisingly classy (and casual). Never felt the need to review until now--- showing my support to this awesome local business. The staff was great to work with as well.
What's not to love? This place is great and the staff is always friendly. It's a DC staple
User_Name: well worth heading up to NW and the pizza is always yummy!""

Review_Contents: So.... the other night I really wanted to go bowling and NOT swanky overpriced drinks plus you need a reservation Lucky Strikes type bowling. I was looking for the real salt of the earth style bowling - give me an AMF with a sports bar and I'm a happy girl. Sadly

The beer list is highly respectable - we had some good brews and while the list isn't long it is really diverse. The highlight of the evening was our bartender Chris.. he was super funny and took some time to clue the newbies in on some great spots to check out in DC. I got a gluten-free tomato pie with kalamata olives and spinach and my brother got a regular one with a weird combo of toppings (his choice). This was the worst gluten-free pizza I've had in a while! The crust was spongy and soggy and felt wet. The toppings were sparse (maybe 6 olives on the whole thing?) and bland. I ended up toasting the slice in a skillet just to try to get the crust to firm up a little. Somewhat successful. GF pizzas look small and wimpy most of the time so I appreciated that this was big (even bigger than my brother's non-GF pie)...until I took a bite and realized that the size was maybe the only impressive thing. I only ate half of mine. I might give the rest of it another shot tomorrow

Review_Contents: We waited an hour and 15 minutes for a table on a Saturday night after the hostess estimated an hour wait. ニ_ニ_The hostess did not give us menus but we were sitting close enough so I could grab them. ニ_ニ_We waited 15 minutes for our server to even come over and get our orders. ニ_ニ_Luckily the food came out quickly. Do not order the breadsticks - they were 3 pieces of bread warmed with ranch. ニ_ニ_One of the people in our party had to ask 3 times for a drink because they were out of what she had originally ordered. ニ_ニ_The pizza was ok not great. ニ_ニ_We had to wait again to get our check. ニ_ニ_It was very crowded and chaotic at the hostess stand and the door so it was very difficult to get to our table. ニ_ニ_Very disappointing.
My girlfriend and I recently stopped here on our way out of D.C. after seeing a GroupOn for it and of course we had seen it on Diners
Review_Cool: and Dives so we definitely had to stop here.The wings were really good and different and the beer selection was good so that put us off to a good start. I did ask for water and he forgot though. I also couldn't get my first choice of pizza because they were out of asparagus. After the initial beer and wings things slowed down dramatically though.Don't know why but the pizza took forever though. He apologized and said it was coming soon so not a big deal but didn't really get an explanation.Anyway I ordered """"The Time Out"""" which was probably the best pizza I've ever had honestly so I guess it was worth the wait in the end. My girlfriend ordered a seasonal pizza with squash in it which I forget the name which was really good also.All in all a really cool place. Great decor and atmosphere. Just don't be in a rush and enjoy some ping pong while you're downing a beer!""

Review_Contents: I couldn't find the dang bathroom in this place. I looked behind curtains. Wandered into a store room. Accidentally walked outside at one point. So when I did find it
User_Name: it was a cool little surprise. It was like a hidden panic room full of urinals and classical painting featuring aristocrats playing ping pong. It was worth a giggle while I peed. ニ_ニ_The place has a unique style. It's a limited menu but the pizza was very good. Eat it all in one sitting though. I packed a bit to take home and it's not so awesome the next day.It cost more than I like to pay for pizza and beer

I like the concept - pizza and ping pong. Very casual. The inside was not what I was expecting considering the sign itself is so retro. It is a really cool space (much bigger than I thought it would be). The workers are hipster and that vibe carries throughout. The service was great. Review_Cool: bresaola) but all of them were tasty. The $2.50 PBRs were perfect for our group (although they do have a better beer selection for people with more sophisticated drinking paletes). Review_Contents: Awesome place for dinner. The beer selection is good. The bloody Mary was delicious. We ordered the wings which were not your typical hot wing. They were almost like jerk with a hint of sweetness; the meat fell right off the bone. The cream dipping sauce was fantastic. I ordered the pizza that had clams on it and added bacon. It was amazing. My husband got the one with black beans and it too was excellent. For dessert
User_Name: a ginger snap ice cream sandwich...WOW!!!! The service was very good. Not your typical pizza joint. ニ_ニ_We will certainly be back again.""

Review_Contents: Fun place with great pizza. ニ_ニ_Very good beers. ニ_ニ_Try the Yalie and add bacon. ニ_ニ_It's becoming a family tradition to go to Comet Ping Pong when we visit our son at college.

Really stellarThe Hottie- My faveThe Stanley- also greatThe Yaley- YUMyou must request their' wing sauce for your pizza crust. It's a white horseradishy-ranch dressing and it's incredible.

Love this place. The chicken wings are to die for. The dipping sauce that comes with it makes you want to bathe in it. So good. Every pizza is awesome. The service is always spot on. If you want to play ping pong just challenge some little kids to a game and you'll be outmatched.
